00020 #include "util/CelCheck.h"
00021 #include "util/PgOptions.h"
00022 #include "util/RegressionCheck.h"
00023 #include "util/Util.h"
00024 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00025 //
00026 #include <cstdlib>
00027 #include <cstring>
00028 #include <iostream>
00029 #include <string>
00030 //
00031 
00032 using namespace std;
00033 const int passed = 0;
00034 const int failed = 1;
00035 
00036 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00037 {
00038   try {
00039 
00040     //If no arguments given
00041     if(argc == 0) 
00042       {
00043         cout<<"Error: Incorrect number of arguments passed to Cel Check"<<endl;
00044         return failed;
00045       } 
00046     else 
00047       {
00048         PgOptions* opts = new PgOptions();
00049       
00050         //Set Usage message for Cel Check
00051         opts->setUsage("\n\n*****apt-check-cel Help*****");
00052       
00053         //Define acceptable Command Line arguments for apt-check-cel
00054         opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00055                            "A bool value, answer true if you want help!",
00056                            "false");    
00057         opts->defineOption("n", "gen", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00058                            "A String representing the Generated Files to check - the test file",
00059                            "");
00060         opts->defineOption("g", "gold", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00061                            "String representing the Gold file to check against - the perfect/reference file",
00062                            "");
00063         opts->defineOption("p", "prefix", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00064                            "A string representing hte prefix for the header string alg part",
00065                            "");
00066         opts->defineOption("e", "epsilon", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00067                            "A double that is the maximum accetable difference calculated",
00068                            "0");
00069         opts->defineOption("d", "diffAllowed", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00070                            "An integer representing the number of acceptable mismatches/errors before the check fails",
00071                            "0");
00072         opts->defineOption("v", "expectedRetVal", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00073                            "An integer value representing the desired return value used to flag a positive or negative test.  0 is positive, 1 is negative",
00074                            "0");
00075         opts->defineOption("t", "testName", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00076                            "Name of the Test being Run",
00077                            "");
00078 
00079         //Parse argv and store it within PgOptions class variables
00080         //Match the command line arguments to the proper options
00081         opts->parseArgv(argv);
00082 
00083 
00084         if(opts->getBool("help") == true)
00085           {
00086             opts->usage();
00087             return passed;
00088           }
00089 
00090         std::string gen;
00091         std::string gold;
00092         if(opts->get("gen") != "") {
00093           gen = opts->get("gen");
00094         } else {
00095           cout<<"Error: No value for Generated Files (gen) given.  Exiting"<<endl;
00096           return failed;
00097         }
00098 
00099         if(opts->get("gold") != "") {
00100           gold = opts->get("gold");
00101         } else {
00102           cout<<"Error: No value for Gold Files (gold) given.  Exiting"<<endl;
00103           return failed;
00104         }
00105       
00106         //Store variable values
00107         double eps = opts->getDouble("epsilon");
00108         std::string prefix = opts->get("prefix");
00109         int diffAllowed = opts->getInt("diffAllowed");
00110         int expectedRetVal = opts->getInt("expectedRetVal");
00111         std::string testName = opts->get("testName");
00112 
00113         //Run Check
00114         CelCheck* cCheck;
00115         cCheck = new CelCheck(gen, gold, eps, prefix, diffAllowed);
00116         string errorMsg = "";
00117         bool pass =  cCheck->check(errorMsg);
00118 
00119         //Test for Regular Pass (Positive)
00120         if(expectedRetVal == 0)
00121           {
00122             if(!pass)
00123               {
00124                 cout<<"Error in " + testName + "(): " + errorMsg<<endl;
00125                 cout<<"Error: Failed Cel Check"<<endl;
00126                 return failed;
00127               }
00128             else
00129               {
00130                 cout<<"Passed Cel Check"<<endl;
00131                 return passed;
00132               } 
00133           }
00134         //Test for Negative
00135         else
00136           {
00137             if(pass)
00138               {
00139                 cout<<"Error in " + testName + "(): " + errorMsg<<endl;
00140                 cout<<"Error: Failed Cel Check"<<endl;
00141                 return failed;
00142               }
00143             else
00144               {
00145                 cout<<"Passed Cel Check"<<endl;
00146                 return passed;
00147               } 
00148           }
00149 
00150       }
00151   } 
00152   catch(...) 
00153     {
00154       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00155       return failed;
00156     }
00157   return failed;
00158 }
